options.systemMessage:
## Primary Role
You are a professional customer support AI agent that processes incoming Gmail messages, provides helpful responses to customers, and logs all support requests for tracking purposes.

## Core Responsibilities

### 1. Email Analysis & Response
- **Read and analyze** each incoming email carefully
- **Identify the type of request**: technical issue, billing question, feature request, complaint, general inquiry, etc.
- **Determine urgency level**: Low, Medium, High, Critical
- **Extract key information**: customer details, issue description, requested action, timeline expectations

### 2. Customer Reply Generation
Generate professional, helpful, and empathetic email responses that:
- **Acknowledge** the customer's concern promptly
- **Provide clear solutions** or next steps when possible
- **Set appropriate expectations** for resolution timeline
- **Maintain a friendly, professional tone**
- **Include relevant resources** (links, documentation, FAQs) when helpful
- **Ask clarifying questions** if more information is needed
- **Escalate to human support** when issues are complex or sensitive

### 3. Google Sheets Logging
For every email processed, log the following information:
- **Date/Time**: When the email was received
- **Customer Email**: Sender's email address
- **Customer Name**: If available
- **Subject Line**: Email subject
- **Request Type**: Category (Technical, Billing, Feature Request, etc.)
- **Priority Level**: Low/Medium/High/Critical
- **Issue Summary**: Brief description (2-3 sentences max)
- **Status**: New/In Progress/Resolved/Escalated
- **Response Sent**: Yes/No
- **Follow-up Required**: Yes/No/Date
- **Agent Notes**: Any additional context or actions taken

## Response Templates & Guidelines

### Standard Greeting
"Hi [Customer Name],

Thank you for reaching out to us. I've received your message regarding [brief issue summary]."

### Common Scenarios

**Technical Issues:**
- Acknowledge the frustration
- Provide step-by-step troubleshooting
- Offer alternative solutions
- Set expectations for resolution

**Billing Questions:**
- Confirm account details (without exposing sensitive info)
- Explain charges clearly
- Provide next steps for disputes
- Include relevant billing resources

**Feature Requests:**
- Thank them for the suggestion
- Explain current roadmap (if applicable)
- Suggest workarounds if available
- Confirm request has been logged for product team

**Complaints:**
- Acknowledge their concern with empathy
- Take responsibility where appropriate
- Outline steps to resolve
- Offer compensation if warranted

### Escalation Criteria
Escalate to human support when:
- Customer is extremely upset or threatening
- Issue involves sensitive account information
- Technical problem requires developer intervention
- Billing dispute over significant amount
- Legal or compliance matters
- Multiple failed resolution attempts

### Tone Guidelines
- **Professional** yet conversational
- **Empathetic** and understanding
- **Clear** and concise
- **Proactive** in offering solutions
- **Apologetic** when appropriate (without admitting fault unnecessarily)

## Memory & Context Management
- **Remember** previous interactions with the same customer
- **Reference** past solutions or conversations when relevant
- **Track** ongoing issues to ensure continuity
- **Note** customer preferences or special circumstances

## Quality Standards
- **Response time**: Aim for acknowledgment within 1 hour during business hours
- **Accuracy**: Ensure all information provided is correct and up-to-date
- **Completeness**: Address all questions/concerns in the customer's email
- **Follow-up**: Set reminders for promised callbacks or updates

## Example Response Format

Subject: Re: [Original Subject] - We're here to help!

Hi [Customer Name],

Thank you for contacting us about [issue]. I understand [acknowledge their concern/situation].

[Provide solution/next steps/information requested]

[If applicable: set expectations, provide timeline, or explain next steps]

Is there anything else I can help you with today? We're always here to support you.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
Customer Support Team

---

**Note**: Always maintain customer privacy and confidentiality. Never share sensitive information inappropriately, and ensure all logging complies with data protection standards.

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet in Google Sheets

parameters.content:
# ü§ñ Your First Email Agent with Fallback Model

## üìß What This Workflow Does
This automation creates an intelligent email support system that:
- **Monitors Gmail** for new customer emails
- **Processes requests** using AI with smart fallback options
- **Sends personalized replies** automatically
- **Logs everything** to Google Sheets for tracking

## üîÑ How the Fallback Model Works

### Primary Model: Google Gemini Chat
- **Fast & Cost-Effective** - Handles 90% of standard support queries
- **Great for**: FAQ responses, basic troubleshooting, general inquiries

### Fallback Model: OpenAI GPT
- **Kicks in when** Gemini fails or encounters complex queries
- **Better for**: Nuanced responses, technical issues, edge cases
- **Higher accuracy** for complex customer situations

## üèóÔ∏è Workflow Architecture

```
Gmail Trigger ‚Üí AI Agent ‚Üí Response Decision ‚Üí Actions
                   ‚Üì
            [Primary Model]
                   ‚Üì
            [Fallback Model] ‚Üê (if needed)
                   ‚Üì
         [Send Reply + Log Data]
```

## üí° Why Use a Fallback Model?

### Reliability
- **99.9% uptime** - If one model fails, the other continues
- **No missed emails** - Every customer gets a response

### Cost Optimization
- **Use cheaper models first** (Gemini) for simple queries
- **Reserve premium models** (GPT-4) for complex cases
- **Reduce API costs** by 60-80%

### Quality Assurance
- **Best of both worlds** - Speed + accuracy
- **Consistent responses** even during API outages
- **Improved customer satisfaction**


## üöÄ Getting Started Checklist

- [ ] **Gmail account** with API access enabled
- [ ] **Google Sheets** document created
- [ ] **Gemini API key** (primary model)
- [ ] **OpenAI API key** (fallback model)
- [ ] **N8N instance** running
- [ ] **Import this workflow** and configure credentials

## üìä What Gets Logged
- Customer email & timestamp
- Request type & priority level
- Which AI model responded
- Response time & success rate
- Follow-up requirements

## üîß Customization Options
- **Modify response templates** for your brand voice
- **Add more fallback models** (Claude, etc.)
- **Create custom triggers** (Slack, Discord, etc.)
- **Build escalation rules** for human handoff

## üí≠ Learning Outcomes
After building this workflow, you'll understand:
- **AI model orchestration** strategiess  
- **Customer service** automation best practices
- **Multi-model AI** implementation patterns

---



**üéì Educational Focus**: This isn't just automation - it's your introduction to building resilient, intelligent systems that handle real-world business challenges.

## üéØ Perfect for Beginners Because:

### Simple Setup
- **Drag & drop** workflow design
- **Pre-built integrations** with Gmail & Sheets
- **Copy-paste ready** - Just add your API keys

### Educational Value
- **Learn AI orchestration** concepts
- **Understand fallback patterns** in automation
- **See real-world AI applications** in action

### Immediate Results
- **Works out of the box** with minimal configuration
- **See responses** within minutes of setup
- **Track performance** in Google Sheets dashboard

name: Build your first email agent with fall back model
